text: Prepare the baking tray/sheet by covering with baking/parchment paper.  Add all of the ingredients to the mixing bowl. Mix thoroughly. Put the bowl into the microwave. Heat for 30 seconds or until the mixture is warmed up but not boiling. Spread the heated mixture across the baking tray to a thickness of about 2cm (1"). Place the tray into the freezer for half an hour. Remove the tray from the freezer.  Preheat the oven to 230ºC/450ºF.  Remove the dough from the tray. Cut it into small squares around 2cm (1") across. Form each square into a small ball with your hands. Return the balls to the covered baking tray. Place the balls into the oven to cook for 6 minutes. Turn the balls over at the halfway mark. Remove the balls from the oven. Allow to cool on the wire cooling rack. Once cooled they're ready to serve.
